required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of EMB-02 in Participants With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Trial of EMB-02, a Bi-specific Antibody Against PD-1 and LAG-3, in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to identify the recommended Phase 2 dose(s) (RP2Ds) and schedule assessed to be safe for EMB-02 and to characterize the safety and tolerability of EMB-02 at the RP2Ds. Pharmacokinetics (PK), immunogenicity, and the anti-tumor activity of EMB-02 will also be assessed.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase I/II, multi-center, open label, multiple-dose, first in human study, designed to assess safety and tolerability, and to identify the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and/or recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) for EMB-02 in patients with advanced solid tumors. Pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, immunogenicity, and response will also be assessed.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Dose escalation followed by Cohort Expansion Phase at the RP2D.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events as assessed by CTCAE V5.0
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to follow-up (30 days after the last dose)
Screening up to follow-up (30 days after the last dose)
Screening up to follow-up (30 days after the last dose)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of dose interruptions of EMB-02 during treatment as a measure of tolerability.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening up to follow-up (30 days after the last dose)
primary_outcome.description: Actual amount of drug taken by patients divided by the planned amount.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of DLTs during the first cycle of treatment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: First infusion to the end of Cycle 1 (each cycle is 28 days)
primary_outcome.description: The Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) are based on drug related adverse events and are specifically defined in study protocol.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of dosing until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, expected average 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Measured by RECIST 1.1, only applicable in Phase II part

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the serum concentration-time curve (AUC) of EMB-02
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (AUC).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (Cmax)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (Ctrough)

secondary_outcome.measure: Average concentration over a dosing interval (Css, avg)of EMB-02.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (Css, avg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (T1/2)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (CL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Steady state volume of distribution (Vss) of EMB-02
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through treatment until EOT visit, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for serum PK analysis will be obtained (Vss).

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression free survival (PFS) of EMB-02 as assessed by RECIST 1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of dosing until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Preliminary anti-tumor activity of EMB-02 will be obtained (PFS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of response of EMB-02 as assessed by RECIST 1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of dosing until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, expected average 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Preliminary anti-tumor activity of EMB-02 will be obtained (DOR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and titer of anti-drug antibodies stimulated by EMB-02
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to End of Treatment Follow Up Period (30 days after the last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibodies to EMB-02 will be assessed to evaluate potential immunogenicity.

arm_group.description: In Phase I part: participants enrolled in the different time will receive EMB-02 once weekly (IV) at different ascending dose levels. In Phase II part: participants will receive EMB-02 once weekly (IV) at previously defined RP2D.

intervention.description: EMB-02 is a FIT-Ig® bispecific antibody against PD-1 and LAG-3.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Willing and able to provide written informed consent.
- Phase I: Patients with histologically or cytologically confirmed locally advanced/metastatic solid tumors and have failed (progressed on, or are intolerant of) standard therapies. Moreover, the disease should be measurable or evaluable per RECIST v1.1
- Phase II Cohort A: Patients with histologically or cytologically confirmed locally advanced/metastatic melanoma, excluding uveal melanoma. > 1 prior therapy, including prior treatment with PD-1/L1(mandatory) and/or CTLA-4 inhibitors(optional). And the disease is measurable or evaluable per RECIST v1.1
- Archival tumor samples available for retrospective analysis or biopsy will be taken.
- ECOG performance status 0 or 1 for phase I, and ≤2 for phase II; life expectancy > 3 Months
- Adequate organ function to participate in the trial.
- Recovery from adverse events (AEs) related to prior anticancer therapy.
- Highly effective contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease
- History of severe irAE.
- History of severe allergic reactions
- Use of systemic corticosteroids.
- Symptomatic central nervous system metastases.
- Patients with cardiac dysfunction
- Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus with hemoglobin A1c > 8% (via medical history)
- Prior treatment with a LAG-3 inhibitor
- Anticancer therapy or radiation < 5 half-lives or 4 weeks (whichever is shorter) prior to study treatment;
- Prior organ or stem cell/bone marrow transplant.
- Concurrent malignancy < 5 years prior to entry.
- Patients with active infections.
- Major surgery < 4 weeks or minor surgery < 2 weeks prior to study treatment
- Live virus vaccines < 30 days prior to screening
- Pregnant or breast-feeding females
- Any investigational agents or study drugs from a previous clinical study within 30 days of the first dose of study treatment
- Any other serious underlying medical conditions
- Abuse on alcohol, cannabis- derived products or other drugs
